definitions.definition: a cry made as a summons or to attract someone's attention.
examples: a nearby fisherman heard their calls for help
synonyms: vociferation; informalholler "I heard calls from the auditorium"

definitions.definition: the characteristic cry of a bird or other animal.
examples: it is best distinguished by its call, a loud “pwit”

definitions.definition: a series of notes sounded on a brass instrument as a signal to do something.
examples: a bugle call to rise at 5:30

definitions.definition: a direction in a square dance given by the caller.

examples: the alternative call of 2♠ would be quite unsound

definitions.definition: an instance of speaking to someone on the phone or attempting to contact someone by phone.
examples: I'll give you a call at around five
synonyms: ring; informalbuzz "I'll give you a call tomorrow"

examples: we paid a call on Howard
synonyms: social call "he paid a call on Harold"

definitions.definition: a visit or journey made by a doctor or other professional in response to a request for help, especially in an emergency situation.
examples: the ambulance is out on a call

definitions.definition: an appeal or demand for something to happen or be done.
examples: the call for action was welcomed
synonyms: entreaty More"a call for party unity"summons
request "the last call for passengers on flight 701"

definitions.definition: demand or need for (goods or services).
examples: there was little call for work as sophisticated as his
synonyms: market "there's no call for expensive wine here"

definitions.definition: an order or request for someone to be present.
examples: he was delighted that so many former players had heeded the call to attend the conference
synonyms: request "the last call for passengers on flight 701"

examples: feeling the call to ministry, I started looking for a Bible college
hikers can't resist the call of the Sierras

definitions.definition: (in sports) a decision or ruling made by an umpire or other official, traditionally conveyed by a shout, that the ball has gone out of play or that a rule has been breached.
examples: he was visibly irritated with the umpire's calls
personally, I'm all in favor, but it's your call

definitions.definition: a command to execute a subroutine.
examples: parameter values may be changed by calls to a special purpose input specification subroutine

definitions.definition: a demand for payment of lent or unpaid capital.
